job_description:
• Prior internship or lab experience in semiconductor manufacturing or process engineering.
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
• Currently pursuing a B.
• In Electrical Engineering, Materials Science, Chemical Engineering, or a related field.
• Familiarity with semiconductor fabrication and process flows is a plus.
• Knowledge of SPC, DOE, and yield analysis methodologies.
• Proficient in Excel, JMP, and data visualization tools.
• Intern – Device and Process Integration Engineer ID1Boise, Idaho, United States of AmericaPosted 17 hours ago Intern - Process Integration – Advanced PackagingBoise, Idaho, United States of AmericaPosted 20 days ago Intern - Process Integration – Advanced PackagingBoise, Idaho, United States of AmericaPosted a month ago Engineer/ Senior Engineer NTI NAND Process Integration (CMOS )Singapore, SingaporePosted 2 months ago.

• Join our 30,000 everyday heroes.
• A global technology and professional services company that delivers consulting, technology and mission services to every major agency across the U.
• Government, defense and intelligence community.
• Our 30,000 experts extract the power of technology to create immediate value and deliver solutions at the edge of innovation.
• We operate across 30 countries worldwide, offering leading capabilities in digital modernization, AI/ML, Cloud, Cyber and application development.
• Together with our clients, we strive to create a safer, smarter world by harnessing the power of deep expertise and advanced technology.
• For more information about GDIT's Privacy Policy, click here: https://www.
• Com/privacy-policy/notices/.

• Minimum QualificationsBS in Computer Science or a similar fieldUp to 10% domestic and international travel requiredExpertise in programing in C++, Objective C, Go or SwiftExperience with one or more scripting languages such as Python, Perl, shell scripts, etc.

• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to meet software engineering requirements.
• The ideal candidate will have experience in Microchip firmware (MPLAB, Harmony), embedded Linux (ARM SoCs, Quartus), C++ GUI development with Qt, and networking (TCP/UDP).
• You'll translate customer needs into technical solutions and support project development end-to-end.
• Security clearance eligibility required (DoD preferred).
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to meet software engineering requirements.
